artist: Silversmith: Paul Storr; Manufacturer: Rundell, Bridge & Rundell
creditline: Gift of James F. and Louise H. Bell
description: one of a pair of entree dishes with covers; engraved with royal coat of arms, finials in form of owner's crest; gadrooned borders, high domed covers with gadrooned mouldings
inscription:
Engraving

-Engraved on opposite sides of each lid are the arms, motto, and supporters of Ouseley impaling Whitelock, and the royal arms of George III.  On the side of each bowl is engraved the badge of the Order of the Garter and the crest of Ouseley (out of a ducal coronet or a wolf\'s head argent).  The order of the garter is engraved on each dish.
markings:
Royal Coat of Arms

-Each fully marked on side of dish.  Maker\'s mark, lion passant, and date letter on each cover.  Maker\'s mark, lion passant, and sovereign\'s head on underside of each finial.  Each cover and dish stamped [1] and [2] respectively.  Both covers and both dishes stamped [376].
object_name: Covered Entrée Dish, one of a pair
title: Covered Entrée Dish, one of a pair
